comments:
1. Open the Task view
2. Go to the view toolbar menu > Preferences...
3. Type down an unallowed expression("abcd", "0.54", etc.) and click OK

Result: An error is logged

It's fixed on the 3.4 stream : OK button enablement is bound to the IntegerFieldEditor's state, so you can't validate the dialog unless you set a valid positive integer.
IMHO it should be backported on 3.3 maintenance stream

Also this is the same case in the problems view:

1. Open the Problems view
2. Go to the view toolbar menu > Preferences...
3. Type down a negative number("-6") and click OK

Result: An error is logged and the negative number is saved in the view preferences  


Additional Information  :

Error
Fri Nov 30 15:41:03 EET 2007
An internal error occurred during: "Process resource updates".

java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
    at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(Unknown Source)
    at java.util.ArrayList.get(Unknown Source)

    at org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.MarkerView$MarkerProcessJob.run(MarkerView.java:151)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

It's the same code, and so it also has been fixed in 3.4 stream.
Bookmark view, Problem view & Task view all share the same "MarkerViewPreferenceDialog".

The only problem is : should this fix be backported to 3.3 maintenance stream. I think it should.
